::: {#hero-heading}
This soil information system is a foundational information infrastructure offered by the Kenya Agricultural and Livestock Research Organization (KALRO). It brings together soil data from across projects and provides access to nationally-consistent, standardized and readily useable soil data and information to support evidence-based decisions on sustainable land management in Kenya. The soil data are systematically generated, collated, curated, standardized, catalogued and maintained by the Kenya Soil Survey (KSS) section within KALRO, which is recognized by the government of Kenya as providing the national reference centre for soils. We hope this platform will be a valuable resource for every stakeholder interested in Kenyaâ€™s soils.
:::

## Explore Resources 

## [Data](data/index.qmd)

Access soil data and maps from several soil survey missions across Kenya. The maps depict the predicted distribution of soil properties and soil health indicators, such as soil erosion risk, soil nutrient depletion, soil organic carbon decline, soil acidity, etc. [Read more about data](data.md)

::: {#data}
:::

Looking for published soil survey reports, guides, standard operating procedures and protocols for soil data collection, analysis, curation, management, modelling, mapping, application and service? Access them here [Read more ...](publication.md)

## Our Commitment

We are committed to:

- Providing **open, standardized, high-quality** soil information  
- Supporting **evidence-based decision-making**  
- Advancing **soil science research** in Kenya  
- Enabling sustainable management of natural resources
